1Q6.F.summary: Prosafe SE, together with its subsidiaries, owns and operates semi-submersible accommodation vessels in Europe, South America, and internationally. Its accommodation vessels are used for accommodation, engineering, construction, or storage capacity offshore. The company is also involved in the maintenance and modification of installations on fields for the production, hook-up and commissioning of new fields, tie-backs to existing infrastructure, and decommissioning activities. It owns and operates a fleet of seven semi-submersible accommodation vessels and one tender support vessel. The company primarily serves oil and gas industries. Prosafe SE was founded in 1972 and is based in Stavanger, Norway.

26Q.F.summary: AqualisBraemar LOC ASA, an investment holding company, provides marine and engineering consultancy services to the offshore oil and gas industry and offshore renewables market worldwide. It offers marine and offshore engineering services, such as deep and shallow water installation engineering; marine operations and surveying, including rig moving and tow master, as well as engineering support services; owns and supervises vessel construction; engineering and project management services; concept, FEED, and basic design services for new-build and vessel upgrades; and rig inspection services. The company also provides marine warranty and consultancy, risk consulting, transportation and installation, dynamic positioning and critical systems, and technical due diligence services. The company was formerly known as AqualisBraemar ASA and changed its name to AqualisBraemar LOC ASA in December 2020. AqualisBraemar LOC ASA was incorporated in 2014 and is headquartered in Oslo, Norway.

2HX.F.summary: Hexagon Composites ASA, together with its subsidiaries, produces and sells composite pressure cylinders and fuel systems for mobility, industrial, and consumer applications in Norway, Europe, North America, South-East Asia, the Middle East, and internationally. The company operates through Agility, Hexagon Purus, Hexagon Mobile Pipeline & Other, and Hexagon Ragasco LPG segments. It provides compressed natural gas, liquid natural gas, and propane hydrogen fuel systems, as well as Type 4 composite cylinders for medium- and heavy-duty commercial vehicles. The company also develops and supplies high-pressure composite cylinders and solutions for a range of hydrogen applications, as well as compressed natural gas (CNG) fueled light-duty vehicles; and high-pressure composite storage and transportation cylinders and modules for CNG and biogas. In addition, it manufactures low-pressure composite cylinders for propane gas. The company serves the aerospace, automotive, industrial gas, liquefied petroleum gas, marine, mining, oil and gas, rail, and utilities industries. Hexagon Composites ASA is headquartered in Ãlesund, Norway.

3SX.F.summary: OKEA ASA, an oil and gas company, engages in the development and production of oil and gas in the Norwegian continental shelf. It holds interests 44.56% in Draugen, 12% in GjÃ¸a, and 0.55% in Ivar Aasen licenses. The company was founded in 2015 and is headquartered in Trondheim, Norway.

4D6.F.summary: DOF ASA, together with its subsidiaries, owns and operates a fleet of offshore vessels worldwide. The company operates through three segments: Platform Supply Vessel (PSV), Anchor Handling Tug Supply Vessel (AHTS), and Subsea Vessel and Subsea Engineering. It operates a fleet of PSVs that are used to transport oilfield products and supplies to offshore drilling and production facilities; AHTS used to set anchors for drilling rigs, and tow mobile drilling rigs and equipment from one location to another; and subsea vessels used for a range of subsea services. The company also provides subsea services comprising project management, engineering, construction and installation, life-of-field, decommissioning/field abandonment, and survey and positioning, as well as inspection, repair, and maintenance services. In addition, it offers marine management services, such as crewing, chartering, mobilization, maintenance, refurbishment, projects and new building, and compliance services. As of December 31, 2019, the company operated a fleet of 67 vessels, including 16 PSVs, 20 AHTSs, and 31 subsea/construction vessels, as well as 72 remote operated vehicles and 2 autonomous underwater vehicles. It operates in Brazil, the United Kingdom, Australia, Norway, Canada, the United States, Guyana, the Philippines, Angola, Argentina, and internationally. The company was founded in 1981 and is headquartered in StorebÃ¸, Norway.

4SM.F.summary: Magnora ASA operates in the offshore oil and gas market in Norway and the United Kingdom. It primarily focuses on managing the Dana Western Isles and Shell Penguins FPSO license agreements. It serves oil companies and marine contractors. It also focuses on developing wind projects. The company was formerly known as Sevan Marine ASA and changed its name to Magnora ASA in October 2018. Magnora ASA was founded in 2001 and is based in Oslo, Norway.

5M6.F.summary: Magseis Fairfield ASA, a geophysical survey company, engages in the marine seismic operations and seismic related activities. The company provides ocean bottom seismic (OBS) acquisition services to clients using its proprietary Marine Autonomous Seismic System (MASS) that includes ultra-compact 4C sensor capsules, automated handling systems, and data downloads. Its MASS acquisition system allows operating in water depths from 0 to 3,000 meters. The company also provides MASS cable system that enables acquisition in areas with seabed obstructions, various seabed topographies, and deployment in deeper water depths; MASS Modular, a mobile OBS system; and MASS reservoir monitoring services for seismic monitoring. It operates in Norway, Malaysia, Singapore, Red Sea, Sweden, Russia, Mexico, Indonesia, and the United States. The company was formerly known as Magseis ASA. Magseis Fairfield ASA was founded in 2009 and is headquartered in Lysaker, Norway.

AKAAF.summary: Aker ASA, an industrial investment company, operates in the oil and gas, maritime assets, and marine biotechnology sectors primarily in Norway and internationally. It operates through two segments, Industrial Holdings and Financial Investments. The company provides services, technologies, and product solutions for the oil and gas industry; provides engineering, procurement, and construction services for the offshore oil and gas, as well as renewable industries; and explores for and produces oil and gas on the Norwegian continental shelf. It also develops, manufactures, markets, and sells krill-based ingredients to the consumer health, aquaculture, and animal nutrition markets; and owns and charters vessels. The company was founded in 1841 and is headquartered in Lysaker, Norway. Aker ASA is a subsidiary of TRG Holding AS.

AKAST.OL.summary: Akastor ASA operates as an oil-services investment company worldwide. The company offers drilling equipment, drilling riser solutions, and related products and services for the drilling market; and vessel-based subsea well construction and intervention services to the oil and gas industry. It is also involved in waste management drilling activities; the provision of subsurface advice and products to E&P companies; and supplying vapor recovery units and systems. Akastor ASA was founded in 1841 and is based in BÃ¦rum, Norway.

AKKVF.summary: Akastor ASA operates as an oil-services investment company worldwide. The company offers drilling equipment, drilling riser solutions, and related products and services for the drilling market; and vessel-based subsea well construction and intervention services to the oil and gas industry. It is also involved in waste management drilling activities; the provision of subsurface advice and products to E&P companies; and supplying vapor recovery units and systems. Akastor ASA was founded in 1841 and is based in BÃ¦rum, Norway.

AKRBP.OL.summary: Aker BP ASA engages in the exploration, development, and production of oil and gas on the Norwegian Continental Shelf. The company has working interests in 42 fields/projects. As of December 31, 2019, its total net proven reserves were 666 million barrels of oil equivalents; and estimated total net proven plus probable reserves were 906 million barrels of oil equivalents. The company was formerly known as Det norske oljeselskap ASA and changed its name to Aker BP ASA in October 2016. Aker BP ASA was founded in 2001 and is headquartered in Fornebu, Norway.

AKSO.OL.summary: Aker Solutions ASA provides products, systems, and services to the oil and gas industry worldwide. The company operates through Projects and Services segments. It offers field planning, feasibility, and concept studies; floater designs; digital solutions; and deep water risers. The company also provides engineering, project management, and procurement services, such as design of offshore oil and gas production facilities, and onshore receiving and processing facilities; jacket designs; subsea production systems; subsea trees; and control systems. In addition, it offers subsea wellheads engineering, manufacturing, installation, and life-of-field support services, including umbilical systems, subsea structures, tie-in systems, subsea compression and pump systems, subsea power distribution and processing systems, and intervention and workover systems; and lifecycle, hook-up and completion, maintenance, modification, asset integrity management, and yards and fabrication services. Aker Solutions ASA was founded in 1841 and is headquartered in Fornebu, Norway.

AQUA.OL.summary: AqualisBraemar LOC ASA, an investment holding company, provides marine and engineering consultancy services to the offshore oil and gas industry and offshore renewables market worldwide. It offers marine and offshore engineering services, such as deep and shallow water installation engineering; marine operations and surveying, including rig moving and tow master, as well as engineering support services; owns and supervises vessel construction; engineering and project management services; concept, FEED, and basic design services for new-build and vessel upgrades; and rig inspection services. The company also provides marine warranty and consultancy, risk consulting, transportation and installation, dynamic positioning and critical systems, and technical due diligence services. The company was formerly known as AqualisBraemar ASA and changed its name to AqualisBraemar LOC ASA in December 2020. AqualisBraemar LOC ASA was incorporated in 2014 and is headquartered in Oslo, Norway.

BWE.OL.summary: BW Energy Limited engages in the acquisition, exploration, development, and production of oil and natural gas in Africa. It primarily holds interests in three hydrocarbon licenses in Gabon, Brazil, and Namibia. The company was founded in 2016 and is based in Oslo, Norway.

DETNF.summary: Aker BP ASA engages in the exploration, development, and production of oil and gas on the Norwegian Continental Shelf. The company has working interests in 42 fields/projects. As of December 31, 2019, its total net proven reserves were 666 million barrels of oil equivalents; and estimated total net proven plus probable reserves were 906 million barrels of oil equivalents. The company was formerly known as Det norske oljeselskap ASA and changed its name to Aker BP ASA in October 2016. Aker BP ASA was founded in 2001 and is headquartered in Fornebu, Norway.

DNO.OL.summary: DNO ASA engages in the exploration, development, and production of oil and gas assets in the Middle East and the North Sea. Its flagship project is the Tawke field that is located in the Kurdistan region of Iraq. As of December 31, 2019, its proven reserves consisted of 205.6 million barrels of oil equivalent (MMboe); proven and probable reserves included 344.8 MMboe; and proven, probable, and possible reserves consisted of 539.9 MMboe. The company was founded in 1971 and is headquartered in Oslo, Norway.

DNQ.F.summary: Equinor ASA, an energy company, explores for, produces, transports, refines, and markets petroleum and petroleum-derived products, and other forms of energy in Norway and internationally. The company operates through Development & Production Norway; Development & Production Brazil; Development & Production International; Marketing, Midstream & Processing; New Energy Solutions; Technology, Projects & Drilling; Exploration; and Global Strategy & Business Development segments. It also transports, processes, manufactures, markets, and trades in oil and gas commodities, such as crude and condensate products, gas liquids, natural gas, and liquefied natural gas; markets and trades in electricity and emission rights; and operates refineries, processing and power plants, and terminals. In addition, the company develops wind, and carbon capture and storage projects, as well as offers other renewable energy and low-carbon energy solutions. As of December 31, 2019, it had proved oil and gas reserves of 6,004 million barrels of oil equivalent. Equinor ASA has a strategic collaboration agreement with SINTEF. The company was formerly known as Statoil ASA and changed its name to Equinor ASA in May 2018. Equinor ASA was founded in 1972 and is headquartered in Stavanger, Norway.

DNQA.F.summary: Equinor ASA, an energy company, explores for, produces, transports, refines, and markets petroleum and petroleum-derived products, and other forms of energy in Norway and internationally. The company operates through Development & Production Norway; Development & Production Brazil; Development & Production International; Marketing, Midstream & Processing; New Energy Solutions; Technology, Projects & Drilling; Exploration; and Global Strategy & Business Development segments. It also transports, processes, manufactures, markets, and trades in oil and gas commodities, such as crude and condensate products, gas liquids, natural gas, and liquefied natural gas; markets and trades in electricity and emission rights; and operates refineries, processing and power plants, and terminals. E1V.MU.summary: Eidesvik Offshore ASA operates as a shipping company. It operates through Seismic, Subsea/Offshore Wind, Platform Supply, and Other segments. The company delivers shipping services to customers who produce seismic data; subsea inspection, maintenance, repair, and construction services for subsea work in the oil industry; and shipping services the offshore oil industry. It operates 6 large supply and one smaller supply vessels; a fleet of 4 vessels related to seismic; and a fleet of 4 vessels related to subsea/wind. The company is headquartered in BÃ¸mlo, Norway. Eidesvik Offshore ASA is a subsidiary of Eidesvik Invest AS.

EIOF.OL.summary: Eidesvik Offshore ASA operates as a shipping company. It operates through Seismic, Subsea/Offshore Wind, Platform Supply, and Other segments. The company delivers shipping services to customers who produce seismic data; subsea inspection, maintenance, repair, and construction services for subsea work in the oil industry; and shipping services the offshore oil industry. It operates 6 large supply and one smaller supply vessels; a fleet of 4 vessels related to seismic; and a fleet of 4 vessels related to subsea/wind. The company is headquartered in BÃ¸mlo, Norway. Eidesvik Offshore ASA is a subsidiary of Eidesvik Invest AS.

EMGS.OL.summary: Electromagnetic Geoservices ASA, together with its subsidiaries, provides electromagnetic (EM) surveying services to the offshore oil and gas exploration industry. It is involved in the planning, acquisition, processing, modelling, interpretation, and integration of EM data. The company uses its patented electromagnetic survey method to find hydrocarbons in offshore reservoirs. Its products and services include imaging and interpretation, consultancy, magnetotelluric survey, training, and controlled-source electromagnetic surveying services. Electromagnetic Geoservices ASA has operations in Europe, the Middle East, Africa, Norway, North and South America, Asia, and the Pacific Ocean. The company was founded in 2002 and is headquartered in Trondheim, Norway.

EQNR.summary: Equinor ASA, an energy company, explores for, produces, transports, refines, and markets petroleum and petroleum-derived products, and other forms of energy in Norway and internationally. The company operates through Development & Production Norway; Development & Production Brazil; Development & Production International; Marketing, Midstream & Processing; New Energy Solutions; Technology, Projects & Drilling; Exploration; and Global Strategy & Business Development segments. It also transports, processes, manufactures, markets, and trades in oil and gas commodities, such as crude and condensate products, gas liquids, natural gas, and liquefied natural gas; markets and trades in electricity and emission rights; and operates refineries, processing and power plants, and terminals. The company was formerly known as Statoil ASA and changed its name to Equinor ASA in May 2018. Equinor ASA was founded in 1972 and is headquartered in Stavanger, Norway.

The company serves the aerospace, automotive, industrial gas, liquefied petroleum gas, marine, mining, oil and gas, rail, and utilities industries. Hexagon Composites ASA is headquartered in Ãlesund, Norway.

HUNT.OL.summary: Hunter Group ASA, an investment company, focuses primarily on shipping and oil services investments in Norway and internationally. The company develops VLCC construction contracts and options. Its fleet consist of seven identical VLCCs. The company was formerly known as Badger Explorer ASA and changed its name to Hunter Group ASA in May 2017. Hunter Group ASA was founded in 2003 and is headquartered in Oslo, Norway.

HXGCF.summary: Hexagon Composites ASA, together with its subsidiaries, produces and sells composite pressure cylinders and fuel systems for mobility, industrial, and consumer applications in Norway, Europe, North America, South-East Asia, the Middle East, and internationally. The company operates through Agility, Hexagon Purus, Hexagon Mobile Pipeline & Other, and Hexagon Ragasco LPG segments. It provides compressed natural gas, liquid natural gas, and propane hydrogen fuel systems, as well as Type 4 composite cylinders for medium- and heavy-duty commercial vehicles. The company also develops and supplies high-pressure composite cylinders and solutions for a range of hydrogen applications, as well as compressed natural gas (CNG) fueled light-duty vehicles; and high-pressure composite storage and transportation cylinders and modules for CNG and biogas. In addition, it manufactures low-pressure composite cylinders for propane gas. The company serves the aerospace, automotive, industrial gas, liquefied petroleum gas, marine, mining, oil and gas, rail, and utilities industries. Hexagon Composites ASA is headquartered in Ãlesund, Norway.

IOX.OL.summary: Interoil Exploration and Production ASA, together with its subsidiaries, operates as an upstream oil exploration and production company in Norway. The company engages in the acquisition, exploration, development, and operation of oil and natural gas properties. Its portfolio includes two producing licenses and two exploration licenses in Colombia; and one exploration and seven production concessions in Argentina. The company was founded in 2005 and is headquartered in Oslo, Norway.

KY7.F.summary: Akastor ASA operates as an oil-services investment company worldwide. The company offers drilling equipment, drilling riser solutions, and related products and services for the drilling market; and vessel-based subsea well construction and intervention services to the oil and gas industry. It is also involved in waste management drilling activities; the provision of subsurface advice and products to E&P companies; and supplying vapor recovery units and systems. Akastor ASA was founded in 1841 and is based in BÃ¦rum, Norway.

MGN.OL.summary: Magnora ASA operates in the offshore oil and gas market in Norway and the United Kingdom. It primarily focuses on managing the Dana Western Isles and Shell Penguins FPSO license agreements. It serves oil companies and marine contractors. It also focuses on developing wind projects. The company was formerly known as Sevan Marine ASA and changed its name to Magnora ASA in October 2018. Magnora ASA was founded in 2001 and is based in Oslo, Norway.

The company provides ocean bottom seismic (OBS) acquisition services to clients using its proprietary Marine Autonomous Seismic System (MASS) that includes ultra-compact 4C sensor capsules, automated handling systems, and data downloads. The company also provides MASS cable system that enables acquisition in areas with seabed obstructions, various seabed topographies, and deployment in deeper water depths; MASS Modular, a mobile OBS system; and MASS reservoir monitoring services for seismic monitoring. It operates in Norway, Malaysia, Singapore, Red Sea, Sweden, Russia, Mexico, Indonesia, and the United States. The company was formerly known as Magseis ASA. Magseis Fairfield ASA was founded in 2009 and is headquartered in Lysaker, Norway.

OHT.OL.summary: OHT ASA invests in and operates heavy transportation vessels. It transports liftboats, cranes, jackets, barges, dredgers, modules, ship sections, offshore wind foundations, and other floating/non-floating cargoes, as well as jack-up's and semi-submersible drilling rigs. The company owns and operates five open deck semi-submersible heavy transportation vessels. It serves oil and gas, offshore, heavy construction, and other industries, as well as offshore renewables. OHT ASA was founded in 2005 and is headquartered in Oslo, Norway.

OKEA.OL.summary: OKEA ASA, an oil and gas company, engages in the development and production of oil and gas in the Norwegian continental shelf. It holds interests 44.56% in Draugen, 12% in GjÃ¸a, and 0.55% in Ivar Aasen licenses. The company was founded in 2015 and is headquartered in Trondheim, Norway.

PGEJF.summary: PGS ASA operates as a marine geophysical company. The company offers a range of seismic and reservoir services, including acquisition, imaging, interpretation, and field evaluation to oil and gas companies. It operates in Africa, Brazil, Canada, Guyana, the United Kingdom, Norway, Angola, the Asia Pacific, Europe, the Americas, the Middle East, and internationally. The company was formerly known as Petroleum Geo-Services ASA and changed its name to PGS ASA in May 2019. PGS ASA was founded in 1991 and is headquartered in Oslo, Norway.

PGS.OL.summary: PGS ASA operates as a marine geophysical company. The company offers a range of seismic and reservoir services, including acquisition, imaging, interpretation, and field evaluation to oil and gas companies. It operates in Africa, Brazil, Canada, Guyana, the United Kingdom, Norway, Angola, the Asia Pacific, Europe, the Americas, the Middle East, and internationally. The company was formerly known as Petroleum Geo-Services ASA and changed its name to PGS ASA in May 2019. PGS ASA was founded in 1991 and is headquartered in Oslo, Norway.

PRS.OL.summary: Prosafe SE, together with its subsidiaries, owns and operates semi-submersible accommodation vessels in Europe, South America, and internationally. Its accommodation vessels are used for accommodation, engineering, construction, or storage capacity offshore. The company is also involved in the maintenance and modification of installations on fields for the production, hook-up and commissioning of new fields, tie-backs to existing infrastructure, and decommissioning activities. It owns and operates a fleet of seven semi-submersible accommodation vessels and one tender support vessel. The company primarily serves oil and gas industries. Prosafe SE was founded in 1972 and is based in Stavanger, Norway.

Prosafe SE was founded in 1972 and is based in Stavanger, Norway.

It owns and operates a fleet of seven semi-submersible accommodation vessels and one tender support vessel. The company primarily serves oil and gas industries. Prosafe SE was founded in 1972 and is based in Stavanger, Norway.

REACH.OL.summary: Reach Subsea ASA provides subsea services in Norway. The company offers inspection, maintenance, and repair services; and remotely operated vehicles, survey, and construction services. It provides engineering services to the oil industry. The company was formerly known as Transit Invest ASA and changed its name to Reach Subsea ASA in December 2012. Reach Subsea ASA was founded in 2008 and is based in Haugesund, Norway.

SIOFF.OL.summary: Siem Offshore Inc., together with its subsidiaries, owns and operates offshore support vessels for the offshore energy service industry. It operates platform supply vessels (PSVs); offshore subsea construction vessels (OSCVs); anchor-handling tug supply vessels (AHTS vessels); other vessels, including fast crew, fast supply, and oil spill recovery vessels; and scientific core-drilling and others. As of March 31, 2020, it had a fleet of 33 vessels, which included seven PSVs, four OSCVs, ten AHTS vessels, two well-intervention vessels, one scientific core-drilling vessel, five Brazilian flagged vessels, and three Canadian flagged vessels comprising AHTS vessels and PSVs. It operates in Norway, North Sea, the Arctic Ocean, Northern Pacific Ocean, West Africa, Australia, South East Asia, Canada, and Brazil. The company was founded in 2005 and is headquartered in Kristiansand, Norway. Siem Offshore Inc. is a subsidiary of Siem Europe S.a r.l.

SOFF.OL.summary: Solstad Offshore ASA operates offshore service and construction vessels for offshore and renewable energy industry worldwide. The company offers anchor-handling vessels delivering services related to rig moves, and anchoring of rigs and other devices at sea; platform supply vessels that deliver services relating to the transportation of material to offshore installations; and construction service vessels delivering services relating to the development of subsea and floating installations. It operates a fleet of 32 construction service vessels, 42 anchor handling vessels, and 59 platform supply vessels. The company was founded in 1964 and is headquartered in Skudeneshavn, Norway.

STOHF.summary: Equinor ASA, an energy company, explores for, produces, transports, refines, and markets petroleum and petroleum-derived products, and other forms of energy in Norway and internationally. The company operates through Development & Production Norway; Development & Production Brazil; Development & Production International; Marketing, Midstream & Processing; New Energy Solutions; Technology, Projects & Drilling; Exploration; and Global Strategy & Business Development segments. It also transports, processes, manufactures, markets, and trades in oil and gas commodities, such as crude and condensate products, gas liquids, natural gas, and liquefied natural gas; markets and trades in electricity and emission rights; and operates refineries, processing and power plants, and terminals. In addition, the company develops wind, and carbon capture and storage projects, as well as offers other renewable energy and low-carbon energy solutions. The company was formerly known as Statoil ASA and changed its name to Equinor ASA in May 2018. Equinor ASA was founded in 1972 and is headquartered in Stavanger, Norway.

The company was formerly known as Sevan Marine ASA and changed its name to Magnora ASA in October 2018. Magnora ASA was founded in 2001 and is based in Oslo, Norway.

SZL.SG.summary: Solstad Offshore ASA operates offshore service and construction vessels for offshore and renewable energy industry worldwide. The company offers anchor-handling vessels delivering services related to rig moves, and anchoring of rigs and other devices at sea; platform supply vessels that deliver services relating to the transportation of material to offshore installations; and construction service vessels delivering services relating to the development of subsea and floating installations. It operates a fleet of 32 construction service vessels, 42 anchor handling vessels, and 59 platform supply vessels. The company was founded in 1964 and is headquartered in Skudeneshavn, Norway.

TGC.F.summary: TGS-NOPEC Geophysical Company ASA provides geoscientific data products and services to the oil and gas industry worldwide. The company offers geophysical multi-client data, including seismic data; and geophysical library, such as gravity, magnetic, seep, geothermal, controlled source electromagnetic, and multi-beam data. It also provides geological services comprising digital well logs; and interpretation services and other geoscientific data to support hydrocarbon exploration. In addition, the company offers imaging services, which include depth and time imaging; marine, land, and ocean bottom cables and nodes; anisotropic imaging; transition zone processing; multi component processing; shear wave; and 4D time-lapse, as well as wide azimuth data processing. Further, it provides data and analytics solutions; data integration products; and PRIMA, a multi-function exploration software suite. TGS-NOPEC Geophysical Company ASA has a strategic collaborations with Axxis Geo Solutions and Schlumberger Limited for Ocean Bottom Node Projects in North Sea; and CGG, and PGS ASA to offer a shared ecosystem providing direct access to subsurface multi-client data libraries. The company was founded in 1981 and is headquartered in Asker, Norway.
